casebody.data:
Jermaine PATE, Appellant,
v.
STATE of Missouri, Respondent. No. ED 105414 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. FILED: March 27, 2018 Appellant Acting Pro se Jermaine C. Pate, Moberly Correctional Center, Moberly, MO. Dora A. Fichter, Assistant Attorney General, Jefferson City, MO, for respondent. Before Lisa P. Page, P.J., Roy L. Richter, J., and Philip M. Hess, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Jermaine Pate ("Movant") appeals from the motion court's judgment denying his request for post-conviction relief pursuant to Missouri Supreme Court Rule 29.15 following an evidentiary hearing. We affirm.

We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.

The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
